Software Craftsmanship North America

  • Archived source: https://web.archive.org/web/20090626034401/https://scna.softwarecraftsmanship.org/
  • Original URL: https://scna.softwarecraftsmanship.org/
  • Snapshot timestamp: 2009-06-26 08:44:01 UTC

Archive Snapshot

brought to you by Obtiva and 8th Light Home Location Speakers Schedule Sponsorship Wednesday August
26, 2009 Filling up fast! Get your early bird special for only $99 before July 15! Why attend?
Software Craftsmanship North America is planting a root in the industry as a forerunner to the
Craftsmanship movement. SCNA is devoted to the education and development of craftsmanship in
software development. More than 200 attendees will be at SCNA 2009 to share their expertise as both
experienced and aspiring craftsmen. SCNA will present a myriad of opportunities for those skilled
craftsmen as well as those working toward mastery in the field. Software Craftsmanship North America
will provide the ideal personal experience and environment to meet other craftsmen. Whether trying
to develop software skills and techniques, find other companies who take quality and skill
seriously, or find future craftsmen for your company, SCNA is the perfect event for you. SCNA is the
place for software craftsmanship. SEE: Presentations from Masters in the industry, leading concepts
in Software Craftsmanship, and future strategies in software development. SPONSORSHIP: Share your
vision and promote your brand to key people in the industry. NETWORK: Establish new relationships
with other craftsmen and companies that are influential in the craftsmanship movement. SCNA is
organized by Corey Haines - @coreyhaines Dave Hoover - @redsquirrel Micah Martin - @slagyr Kat
Nelson-Reid - @KatNelsonReid Billy Pacholski - @billyp Paul Pagel - @paulwpagel Kevin Taylor -
